conclusion: We have a circuit with: A coil with N = 200 turns, area S = 1 m², and resistance r = 10 Ω; An external resistor R = 50 Ω connected to the coil; A uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the coil plane; A graph showing the magnetic field B changing over time
From the graph in Figure B, B/T starts at around 0.2 at t = 0 and increases linearly to 0.4 at t = 4 s

premise: B/T starts at around 0.2 at t = 0 and increases linearly to 0.4 at t = 4 s
conclusion: The slope of the line is (0.4 - 0.2)/4 = 0.05 T/s
The EMF induced in the coil is given by Faraday's law: ε = -N dΦ/dt = -N d(BS)/dt = -NS dB/dt

premise: The slope of the line is 0.05 T/s

conclusion: R_total = r + R = 10 Ω + 50 Ω = 60 Ω
The power consumed by a resistor is given by P = I² * R
